Package ca.on.oicr.gsi.shesmu.plugin

Interface Definer<T>

All Superinterfaces:
Supplier<T>
public interface Definer<T> extends Supplier<T>
Interface to define actions, constants, functions, and signatures that can be used by olives

    • defineAction

      default <A extends Action> String defineAction(String name, String description, Class<A> clazz, Supplier<A> supplier, Stream<CustomActionParameter<A>> parameters)
      Define a new action
      Type Parameters:
      A - the action type
      Parameters:
      name - the Shesmu name of the action
      description - the help text for the action
      clazz - the class which implements the actions
      supplier - a generator of new instances of this action
      parameters - the parameters that cannot be inferred by annotations
      Returns:
      the full-qualified name to the action

    • defineAction

      <A extends Action> String defineAction(String name, String description, Class<A> clazz, Supplier<A> supplier, Stream<CustomActionParameter<A>> parameters, SupplementaryInformation information)
      Define a new action
      Type Parameters:
      A - the action type
      Parameters:
      name - the Shesmu name of the action
      description - the help text for the action
      clazz - the class which implements the actions
      supplier - a generator of new instances of this action
      parameters - the parameters that cannot be inferred by annotations
      information - any supplementary information to be displayed; this will be invoked when a user request comes it, so it must be fast, but can provide updated information.
      Returns:
      the full-qualified name to the action

    • defineConstant

      String defineConstant(String name, String description, Imyhat type, Object value)
      Define a constant using a particular value
      Parameters:
      name - the name for the constant
      description - the help text for the constant
      type - the Shesmu type for the object
      value - the current value of the object
      Returns:
      the full-qualified name to the constant

    • defineFunction

      String defineFunction(String name, String description, Imyhat returnType, VariadicFunction function, FunctionParameter... parameters)
      Define a function taking many parameters
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the function
      description - the help text of the function
      returnType - the returned Shesmu type of the function
      function - the implementation of the function
      parameters - the Shesmu types and help text of the parameters of the function
      Returns:
      the full-qualified name to the function

    • defineFunction

      <A, R> String defineFunction(String name, String description, ReturnTypeGuarantee<R> returnType, String parameterName, TypeGuarantee<A> parameterType, Function<A,R> function)
      Define a function taking one argument
      Type Parameters:
      A - the function parameter type
      R - the function return type
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the function
      description - the help text of the function
      returnType - the returned Shesmu type of the function
      parameterName - the help text of the parameter
      parameterType - the type of the parameter
      function - the implementation of the function
      Returns:
      the full-qualified name to the function

    • defineFunction

      <A, B, R> String defineFunction(String name, String description, ReturnTypeGuarantee<R> returnType, String parameter1Name, TypeGuarantee<A> parameter1Type, String parameter2Name, TypeGuarantee<B> parameter2Type, BiFunction<A,B,R> function)
      Define a function taking two arguments
      Type Parameters:
      A - the function first parameter type
      B - the function second parameter type
      R - the function return type
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the function
      description - the help text of the function
      returnType - the returned Shesmu type of the function
      parameter1Name - the help text of the first parameter
      parameter1Type - the type of the first parameter
      parameter2Name - the help text of the second parameter
      parameter2Type - the type of the second parameter
      function - the implementation of the function
      Returns:
      the full-qualified name to the function

    • defineRefiller

      String defineRefiller(String name, String description, Definer.RefillDefiner definer)
      Define a new refiller
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the refiller
      description - the help text for the refiller
      definer - the definition for the refiller
      Returns:
      the full-qualified name to the refiller

    • defineSource

      void defineSource(String formatName, int ttl, JsonInputSource source)
      Define a new dynamic input source

      Registration of the same source multiple times all registrations will be concatenated.

      Parameters:
      formatName - the name of the format; if this format is unknown to the server, the registration will be ignored
      ttl - the number of minutes to cache the data before re-requesting it
      source - a provider of the source data as a byte stream of JSON-encoded data in the same format as the /input URLs

    • defineStaticSigner

      <R> String defineStaticSigner(String name, ReturnTypeGuarantee<R> returnType, Supplier<? extends StaticSigner<R>> signer)
      Define a new signature format that is the same for all input objects; it depends only on the olive
      Type Parameters:
      R - the Java type of the signature
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the signature
      returnType - the return type of the signature
      signer - a function to construct new signers
      Returns:
      the full-qualified name to the signer

    • log

      void log(String message, Map<String,String> labels)
      Write out a logging message

      This writes a log message to external services (e.g., Loki). It is important to keep the set of labels small, as unbounded labels make Loki sad. Each plugin's type and configuration file will be automatically added to the label set by Shesmu. The current rule of thumb is that labels should only contain data based on what configuration files provide rather than what olives provide.

      Parameters:
      message - the log message to write
      labels - the labels associated with this message
